alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 2:54AM EDT until May 05 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor small stream or river flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Along the Saco River through Cornish and Limington, Maine. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Water nearing roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated river levels slowly rising to minor flood stage. At 13 feet, the Saco River causes minor flooding along River Road in Cornish and downstream in Limington. Some permanent buildings at local campgrounds become isolated. - Water levels are expected to crest today and begin receding with little to no additional rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cornish and Limington.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
